attributes.action:
Prevent a 2nd referendum on the EU
Respect the fair decision of the UK majority
attributes.additional_details:
The UK voted to leave the EU with nearly a 52% majority.
The minority want to put the UK through a repeat referendum as they did not get their way but where does this stop?
Everyone in the UK had a fair opportunity to have their say and the majority of nearly 4% were in favour of leaving EU.
We must respect the decision of the British public and look forward to a fresh future as a more independent and stronger Britain.
We must not keep holding referendums when a clear decision has been made.
attributes.background:
The UK majority has decided to leave the EU.
Prevent counter petitions for referendums from the minority which risks undermining parliament.
Uphold and respect the values and voices of the British public majority.
When referendums are carried out fairly and equally, honour the majority verdict.
